name: GentleMax Pro Plus

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength system)

notes: Latest generation GentleMax. Larger spot sizes (up to 26mm), higher energy, faster repetition rates than the GentleMax Pro.

richContent.overview: Candela's most powerful dual-wavelength system. Successor to the GentleMax Pro with larger spot sizes, higher energy output, and faster treatment speeds.
richContent.howItWorks: Same dual-wavelength approach (755nm Alexandrite + 1064nm Nd:YAG) with DCD cooling. Spot sizes up to 26mm and higher energy levels allow faster, more effective treatments than the Pro.
typicalUses: All body areas and Fitzpatrick I-VI
Clinics upgrading from GentleMax Pro for faster throughput
richContent.keyFeatures: Spot sizes up to 26mm (vs 24mm on the Pro). Higher energy output for more effective treatment of coarse or resistant hair. The most expensive purpose-built hair removal laser on the market.

name: GentleMax Pro

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength system)

notes: Dual-wavelength Alexandrite + Nd:YAG. Gold standard for versatility. Dynamic Cooling Device (DCD) provides cryogen spray before each pulse.

richContent.overview: Candela's dual-wavelength system combining 755nm Alexandrite and 1064nm Nd:YAG. One of the most widely used professional hair removal lasers worldwide.
richContent.howItWorks: The 755nm targets melanin effectively in lighter skin, while the 1064nm penetrates deeper for darker skin tones. The patented Dynamic Cooling Device (DCD) sprays cryogen milliseconds before each pulse, protecting the skin while the laser reaches hair follicles.
typicalUses: Permanent hair reduction on all body areas
Full Fitzpatrick I-VI range with wavelength switching
richContent.keyFeatures: Adjustable spot sizes up to 24mm for fast treatment of large areas. The DCD cooling significantly reduces discomfort compared to contact cooling methods.

name: GentleMax

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength system)

notes: Predecessor to GentleMax Pro. Dual-wavelength Alexandrite + Nd:YAG.

richContent.overview: Candela's original dual-wavelength system. Predecessor to the GentleMax Pro. Still widely used in clinics.
richContent.howItWorks: Same dual-wavelength approach as the GentleMax Pro (755nm Alexandrite + 1064nm Nd:YAG) with DCD cryogen cooling. Practitioners switch wavelengths based on patient skin type.
typicalUses: Hair removal across all body areas and skin types
Clinics often run it alongside newer equipment
richContent.keyFeatures: Pioneered the dual-wavelength approach that became the industry standard. Same DCD cooling as newer models.

name: GentleLase

skinTypes.displayText: Light to medium skin tones (Alexandrite wavelength)

notes: 755nm Alexandrite only. Excellent for lighter skin tones with dark hair.

richContent.overview: Candela's dedicated 755nm Alexandrite laser, optimized for hair removal on lighter skin types (Fitzpatrick I-IV) with dark hair.
richContent.howItWorks: The 755nm wavelength is highly absorbed by melanin, making it extremely effective at disabling hair follicles. DCD cryogen spray protects surrounding skin before each pulse.
typicalUses: Fair to medium skin with dark hair
All body areas: face, underarms, bikini, legs, arms
richContent.keyFeatures: Fastest treatment times among laser types for appropriate skin tones due to superior melanin absorption at 755nm.

name: GentleLase Pro

skinTypes.displayText: Light to medium skin tones (Alexandrite wavelength)

notes: Updated GentleLase with larger spot sizes and faster repetition rates.

richContent.overview: Enhanced version of Candela's Alexandrite laser with improved speed and larger spot sizes.
richContent.howItWorks: Same 755nm Alexandrite technology as the GentleLase with faster repetition rates and DCD cooling.
typicalUses: Large body areas (full legs, back, chest) treated faster than original GentleLase
Also effective for smaller precision areas
richContent.keyFeatures: Spot sizes up to 24mm. Full leg treatments in under 30 minutes.

name: GentleYAG

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones, especially effective for darker skin (Nd:YAG wavelength)

notes: 1064nm Nd:YAG only. Safe for darker skin tones where Alexandrite cannot be used.

richContent.overview: Candela's dedicated 1064nm Nd:YAG laser, designed specifically for safe hair removal on darker skin types (Fitzpatrick V-VI).
richContent.howItWorks: The 1064nm wavelength penetrates deeper and is less absorbed by epidermal melanin, allowing it to reach follicles without overheating darker skin. DCD cooling adds an extra layer of protection.
typicalUses: Darker skin tones that cannot safely use Alexandrite or diode lasers
Also used on tanned patients
richContent.keyFeatures: Fills a critical need for clinics serving diverse populations. Deeper penetration also effective for coarser hair.

name: Nordlys

skinTypes.displayText: Varies by handpiece attachment

notes: Multi-application platform (formerly Ellipse). Hair removal is one of many applications. Not purpose-built for hair removal.

richContent.overview: Candela's multi-application aesthetic platform (formerly Ellipse). Hair removal is one of many capabilities, not its primary focus.
richContent.howItWorks: Supports multiple handpiece attachments. For hair removal, it uses Alexandrite or Nd:YAG depending on the handpiece selected. Uses contact cooling rather than the DCD system found in the Gentle series.
typicalUses: Clinics offering diverse treatment menus (rosacea, sun damage, skin tightening) alongside hair removal
richContent.keyFeatures: Versatile across many treatments, but dedicated hair removal devices like the Gentle series may deliver better results for that specific application.

name: Vectus

skinTypes.displayText: Light to medium-dark skin tones (diode wavelength)

notes: 810nm diode laser with Skintel melanin reader for personalized settings. Large spot size for fast treatment. Previously Palomar Vectus. Cynosure acquired Palomar Medical in 2013.

richContent.overview: Cynosure's premium 810nm diode laser with the largest spot size available in a diode system. Built for high-volume clinics. Originally developed by Palomar Medical before Cynosure's acquisition in 2013.
richContent.howItWorks: The Skintel melanin reader measures patient skin type objectively to recommend settings, rather than relying on visual assessment. Sapphire contact cooling protects the skin.
typicalUses: Fast treatment of large body areas (back, chest, legs)
High-volume practices where speed matters
richContent.keyFeatures: Skintel melanin reader removes guesswork from parameter selection. Large spot size significantly reduces treatment time. Older units may still carry the Palomar branding.

name: Apogee+

skinTypes.displayText: Light to medium skin tones (Alexandrite wavelength)

notes: 755nm Alexandrite only. High fluence with large spot sizes (up to 15mm). Upgradable to Elite+ by adding 1064nm Nd:YAG module.

richContent.overview: Cynosure's dedicated 755nm Alexandrite laser, built on proven Apogee platform technology. Designed for high fluence with large spot sizes for fast, effective hair removal on lighter skin tones.
richContent.howItWorks: The 755nm Alexandrite wavelength has high melanin absorption for effective hair follicle destruction. SmartCool air cooling delivers continuous cold air before, during, and after each pulse. Spot sizes up to 15mm allow rapid treatment of large areas.
typicalUses: Hair removal on Fitzpatrick I-IV
Large body areas (legs, back, chest) with fast treatment times
Clinics that may later upgrade to dual-wavelength Elite+
richContent.keyFeatures: Permanently reduces hair by an average of 79% after just three treatments according to Cynosure data. Upgradable pathway to Elite+ for clinics wanting to add 1064nm Nd:YAG capability later. SmartCool integrated air cooling for patient comfort.

name: Apogee Elite

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength system)

notes: Dual-wavelength Alexandrite + Nd:YAG.

richContent.overview: Cynosure's dual-wavelength system (755nm Alexandrite + 1064nm Nd:YAG).
richContent.howItWorks: Practitioners select wavelength based on skin type. Both can be used in the same session. SmartCool air cooling protects the skin before, during, and after each pulse.
typicalUses: All body areas and Fitzpatrick I-VI
richContent.keyFeatures: Proven dual-wavelength platform with SmartCool integrated air cooling system.

name: Elite+

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength system)

notes: Dual-wavelength Alexandrite + Nd:YAG. Predecessor to Elite iQ.

richContent.overview: Cynosure's dual-wavelength system (755nm Alexandrite + 1064nm Nd:YAG). Predecessor to the Elite iQ.
richContent.howItWorks: Practitioners select wavelength based on skin type. Both can be used in the same session. Sapphire contact cooling protects the epidermis.
typicalUses: All body areas and Fitzpatrick I-VI
Clinics with diverse patient populations
richContent.keyFeatures: Proven dual-wavelength technology. Many clinics still run Elite+ systems alongside newer equipment due to their reliability.

name: Elite iQ

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength system)

notes: Latest generation dual-wavelength laser from Cynosure. Skintel melanin reader for customized settings.

richContent.overview: Cynosure's latest dual-wavelength system with Skintel melanin reader for objective skin type measurement.
richContent.howItWorks: Skintel reads skin melanin content and recommends wavelength and parameters. Both 755nm Alexandrite and 1064nm Nd:YAG available. Enhanced contact cooling.
typicalUses: All body areas and skin types
Useful for training new practitioners. Skintel guides parameter selection
richContent.keyFeatures: Skintel integration removes guesswork. Larger spot sizes and faster repetition rates than the Elite+.

name: Icon

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (Nd:YAG wavelength)

notes: Multi-application aesthetic platform. Hair removal is one of many treatments available. Not purpose-built for hair removal.

richContent.overview: Cynosure's multi-application platform. Hair removal is one of many capabilities, not its primary purpose.
richContent.howItWorks: Uses 1064nm Nd:YAG for hair removal. Supports multiple handpieces for other treatments (photofacials, scar treatment, skin resurfacing). Contact cooling protects skin.
typicalUses: Practices offering comprehensive aesthetic services beyond just hair removal
richContent.keyFeatures: Versatile platform, but may not match dedicated hair removal systems for efficiency. Safe for darker skin types via the 1064nm wavelength.

name: LightSheer

skinTypes.displayText: Light to medium-dark skin tones (diode wavelength)

notes: Original 810nm diode laser. Industry standard for diode technology.

richContent.overview: Lumenis's original 810nm diode laser that established the standard for diode hair removal. Proven over decades of clinical use.
richContent.howItWorks: 810nm wavelength targets melanin in follicles while contact cooling protects the skin. Adjustable pulse duration and fluence for different hair types and skin tones.
typicalUses: All body areas for Fitzpatrick I-V
The workhorse of many established practices
richContent.keyFeatures: One of the longest clinical track records of any hair removal laser. Well-documented safety profile.

name: LightSheer Duet

skinTypes.displayText: Light to medium-dark skin tones (diode wavelength)

notes: Features vacuum-assisted high-speed handpiece for large areas and standard handpiece for precision work.

richContent.overview: Lumenis's dual-handpiece diode laser featuring vacuum-assisted technology for dramatically faster treatments.
richContent.howItWorks: Two handpieces: a large vacuum-assisted one (HS) for rapid coverage and a standard one (ET) for precision. The vacuum draws skin into the treatment window, bringing follicles closer to the laser and allowing effective treatment at lower, and less painful, fluences.
typicalUses: HS handpiece: backs, legs, chests in under 15 minutes
ET handpiece: face, bikini, underarms
richContent.keyFeatures: Vacuum-assisted technology means faster treatments with less pain. No compromise on efficacy.

name: LightSheer Desire

skinTypes.displayText: Light to medium-dark skin tones (diode wavelength)

notes: Enhanced version with improved ergonomics and treatment speed.

richContent.overview: Enhanced version of the LightSheer Duet with improved ergonomics for practitioners.
richContent.howItWorks: Same 810nm diode and vacuum-assisted dual-handpiece system as the Duet. Improvements focus on handpiece design and cooling.
typicalUses: Same as LightSheer Duet: large areas and precision work
Preferred in busy practices doing back-to-back treatments
richContent.keyFeatures: Reduced practitioner fatigue during long treatment days. Same clinical efficacy as the Duet.

name: LightSheer Quattro

skinTypes.displayText: Light to medium-dark skin tones (diode wavelength)

notes: Latest in LightSheer family with four handpiece options for maximum versatility.

richContent.overview: Lumenis's most advanced diode laser with four handpiece options for maximum versatility.
richContent.howItWorks: Same proven 810nm diode with four handpieces: extra-large vacuum-assisted, large vacuum-assisted, medium, and small precision. Each optimized for specific treatment areas.
typicalUses: Extra-large: full back/legs at record speed
Small: facial hair and touch-ups
richContent.keyFeatures: Four handpiece options cover any treatment scenario in a single device. Fastest treatment speeds available in any diode laser.

name: Splendor X

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength system)

notes: Dual-wavelength Alexandrite + Nd:YAG with square spot shape for even coverage. Primarily designed for hair removal with additional capabilities.

richContent.overview: Lumenis's dual-wavelength system (755nm + 1064nm) with an innovative square spot shape for uniform coverage.
richContent.howItWorks: Unlike round spots that leave gaps or overlap, the square beam provides perfectly uniform coverage in grid patterns. Both wavelengths can be blended simultaneously or used independently. Contact cooling protects skin.
typicalUses: Large flat areas (backs, legs) where even coverage matters most
All skin types with wavelength blending for intermediate tones
richContent.keyFeatures: Square spot eliminates overlap and gaps, reducing treatment time while ensuring even results. Wavelength blending is unique to this platform.

name: Soprano ICE Platinum

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (when used with SHR delivery method)

notes: 810nm diode with SHR (Super Hair Removal) delivery method. Gradual heating approach for reduced discomfort.

richContent.overview: Alma's flagship hair removal laser using SHR (Super Hair Removal), a gradual heating approach that makes treatments virtually painless.
richContent.howItWorks: Instead of high-energy single pulses, SHR delivers rapid low-fluence pulses that gradually heat the follicle. ICE cooling keeps the skin comfortable throughout. This allows safe treatment across all skin types, including tanned skin.
typicalUses: Patients who found traditional laser too painful
All skin types including darker tones
All body areas
richContent.keyFeatures: The SHR continuous motion technique means no overlapping pulses or missed spots. Pain levels significantly lower than traditional pulsed delivery.

name: Soprano Titanium

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (tri-wavelength system)

notes: Tri-wavelength laser combining Alexandrite, diode, and Nd:YAG. SHR delivery method.

richContent.overview: Alma's most advanced platform combining three wavelengths (755nm + 810nm + 1064nm) with SHR delivery in a single handpiece.
richContent.howItWorks: Delivers all three wavelengths simultaneously: 755nm targets superficial hair, 810nm reaches mid-depth, 1064nm penetrates deepest. Combined with SHR gradual heating and ICE cooling.
typicalUses: All skin types and hair types (excluding white/gray)
Patients with mixed hair characteristics or varying skin tones across body areas
richContent.keyFeatures: Simultaneous tri-wavelength delivery is unique to this platform. Treats a wider range of hair types in fewer sessions than single-wavelength systems.

name: Harmony XL Pro

skinTypes.displayText: Varies by handpiece attachment

notes: Multi-application platform with hair removal as one of many uses. Effectiveness depends on which handpiece attachment is used. Not purpose-built for hair removal.

richContent.overview: Alma's multi-application platform supporting 15+ aesthetic treatments. Hair removal is available but not its primary focus.
richContent.howItWorks: Uses interchangeable handpiece modules. For hair removal, either 810nm diode or 1064nm Nd:YAG depending on the installed handpiece. Contact cooling protects skin.
typicalUses: Practices offering comprehensive aesthetics (skin rejuvenation, acne, pigmentation) alongside hair removal
richContent.keyFeatures: Maximum versatility across treatments, but dedicated systems like the Soprano series will outperform it for hair removal specifically.

name: Clarity II

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength system)

notes: Dual-wavelength Alexandrite + Nd:YAG with IntelliTrak technology for consistent coverage.

richContent.overview: Lutronic's dual-wavelength system (755nm + 1064nm) with IntelliTrak sensor-guided coverage technology.
richContent.howItWorks: IntelliTrak uses sensors to guide practitioners for even coverage, preventing missed areas and over-treatment. Air cooling instead of cryogen: no consumable costs.
typicalUses: All skin types with dual-wavelength flexibility
Useful for training new practitioners. IntelliTrak guides treatment
richContent.keyFeatures: IntelliTrak guidance sets it apart from other dual-wavelength platforms. Air cooling eliminates consumable costs.

name: Diolaze XL

skinTypes.displayText: Light to medium-dark skin tones (diode wavelength)

notes: 810nm diode laser with large spot size for fast treatment of large areas.

richContent.overview: InMode's dedicated 810nm diode laser built for speed. One of the largest spot sizes in any diode system.
richContent.howItWorks: Extra-large spot size delivers 810nm energy across a broad area per pulse. Sapphire contact cooling protects skin. High fluence capability for coarse hair.
typicalUses: Large body areas (backs, legs, arms) where speed matters
High-volume practices
richContent.keyFeatures: Good value compared to premium-tier devices while delivering professional-grade results. Large spot size significantly reduces treatment time.

name: Triton

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (tri-wavelength system)

notes: Tri-wavelength laser combining Alexandrite, diode, and Nd:YAG for maximum versatility.

richContent.overview: InMode's tri-wavelength platform (755nm + 810nm + 1064nm). All three wavelengths in one system.
richContent.howItWorks: Each wavelength can be used individually or combined based on patient skin type and hair characteristics. Contact cooling protects skin during treatment.
typicalUses: Clinics serving diverse populations needing wavelength flexibility
Eliminates the need for multiple laser systems
richContent.keyFeatures: Tri-wavelength capability at a lower price point than some competing systems. Significant cost savings versus purchasing separate devices.

name: Tria 4X

skinTypes.displayText: Designed for Fitzpatrick I-IV. Consult your provider for skin type assessment.

notes: Home-use diode laser. Significantly lower power than clinical devices (approximately 20 joules vs 100+ joules for clinical lasers). FDA-cleared for home use. Results require substantially more sessions than clinical treatment. It IS a real laser, but with consumer-grade power levels.

richContent.overview: One of the few true home-use laser devices. Uses an actual 810nm diode laser, not IPL like most home devices.
richContent.howItWorks: Same 810nm diode technology as professional systems but at ~20 J/cm² versus 100+ J/cm² in clinical devices. Built-in skin sensor prevents use on skin darker than Fitzpatrick IV. Small treatment window requires more time per session.
typicalUses: Maintenance between professional treatments
Small areas: upper lip, chin, underarms
Impractical for large areas due to small spot size
richContent.keyFeatures: It IS a real laser, which distinguishes it from the vast majority of home devices (which are IPL). But consumer-grade power means significantly more sessions and slower results than clinical treatment.

name: Tria Precision

skinTypes.displayText: Designed for Fitzpatrick I-IV. Consult your provider for skin type assessment.

notes: Compact home-use laser for smaller areas like face and bikini line. Same diode laser technology as Tria 4X with smaller treatment window. FDA-cleared for home use. Results require substantially more sessions than clinical treatment. It IS a real laser, but with consumer-grade power levels.

richContent.overview: Compact version of Tria's home-use diode laser, designed for smaller facial areas and bikini line.
richContent.howItWorks: Same 810nm diode laser as the Tria 4X at consumer-safe power levels. Smaller treatment window optimized for precise targeting in sensitive areas. Same skin tone sensor as the 4X.
typicalUses: Facial hair: upper lip, chin, sideburns
Bikini line maintenance
Not practical for large body areas
richContent.keyFeatures: Compact design is actually an advantage for facial precision. Same real diode laser technology as the Tria 4X.

name: Motus AX

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (Moveo technology extends Alexandrite safety to darker skin)

notes: 755nm Alexandrite with proprietary Moveo in-motion technology. Distributed in the US by Cartessa Aesthetics. Made in Italy by DEKA (spin-off of El.En Group).

richContent.overview: DEKA's Alexandrite laser that pioneered Moveo in-motion delivery. By gliding the sapphire-tipped handpiece continuously over the skin, it delivers energy at lower fluence per pulse with gradual heating - making treatments virtually painless while extending Alexandrite's effectiveness to darker skin tones.
richContent.howItWorks: The Moveo handpiece's sapphire tip sits flush against the skin, dramatically reducing reflected energy (traditional Alexandrite loses 50%+ to reflection). Continuous gliding motion over small areas gradually heats follicles to destruction without the sharp 'rubber band snap' of traditional pulsed delivery. This allows safe treatment of darker skin types that would normally be risky with Alexandrite.
typicalUses: All skin types including darker tones (Moveo mode)
Fine and light hair where Alexandrite excels
Patients who found traditional laser hair removal too painful
richContent.keyFeatures: Moveo technology fundamentally changed the Alexandrite hair removal experience. Near-zero pain without numbing cream. The sapphire tip's 100% energy absorption (versus ~50% loss from reflection with standard handpieces) means effective treatment at lower power settings.

name: Motus AY

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength with Moveo technology)

notes: Dual-wavelength Alexandrite + Nd:YAG with Moveo technology. Built on the Motus AX hair removal platform with added 1064nm Nd:YAG for vascular treatments. Up to 11 interchangeable handpieces with automatic recognition. Hair removal remains the primary design focus; vascular and pigmented lesion capabilities are secondary. Distributed in the US by Cartessa Aesthetics, internationally by Lynton (UK) and DEKA direct.

richContent.overview: DEKA's dual-wavelength Motus platform combining 755nm Alexandrite and 1064nm Nd:YAG with Moveo in-motion delivery. Extends the Motus AX by adding Nd:YAG for vascular treatments and deeper penetration on darker skin, with up to 11 handpiece configurations and over 200 integrated treatment protocols.
richContent.howItWorks: Same Moveo sapphire-tip technology as the Motus AX, with the addition of 1064nm Nd:YAG for vascular lesions and deeper hair follicle targeting. The system features automatic handpiece recognition and an energy accumulator that tracks delivery and signals when the treatment endpoint is reached. Peak power exceeds 6,000W at 755nm with pulse durations as short as 2ms.
typicalUses: Pain-free hair removal on all skin types (Moveo mode)
Vascular lesions including leg telangiectasias (1064nm)
Benign pigmented lesions (Moveo PL handpiece)
Skin rejuvenation
richContent.keyFeatures: Bridges the Motus AX and AZ+ in DEKA's lineup. Up to 11 handpieces with automatic recognition covering hair removal (HR), vascular lesions (VL), pigmented lesions (PL), and skin rejuvenation (SR). Over 200 integrated protocols. Same pain-free Moveo delivery that defines the Motus family.

name: Motus AZ+

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength with Moveo technology)

notes: Dual-wavelength Alexandrite + Nd:YAG with Moveo technology. Built on the same hair removal core as the Motus AX with expanded handpiece options for vascular, pigmented lesion, and skin rejuvenation treatments. Hair removal remains the primary design focus. Distributed in the US by Cartessa Aesthetics.

richContent.overview: Dual-wavelength upgrade to the Motus AX, adding 1064nm Nd:YAG alongside the 755nm Alexandrite. Both wavelengths benefit from Moveo in-motion delivery for pain-free treatment.
richContent.howItWorks: Same Moveo sapphire-tip technology as the Motus AX, now with the option to switch to 1064nm Nd:YAG for vascular treatments and deeper penetration on darker skin. Multiple Moveo handpiece options cover hair removal (HR), vascular lesions (VL), pigmented lesions (PL), and skin rejuvenation (SR).
typicalUses: Practices wanting both hair removal and vascular/skin treatments from one device
All skin types with dual-wavelength flexibility
Clinics prioritizing patient comfort
richContent.keyFeatures: Combines the pain-free Moveo experience with dual-wavelength versatility. Practices using the Motus AZ+ have reported significant revenue increases from the combination of pain-free marketing and expanded treatment menu.

name: Motus PRO

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength with Moveo + traditional delivery)

notes: Latest generation Motus platform. Adds traditional (pulsed) delivery mode alongside Moveo, plus larger 24mm spot for high-speed treatments. The broadest treatment menu in the Motus family, but the core engineering (Moveo technology, 755nm Alexandrite primary laser) still centers on hair removal. US distribution by Cartessa Aesthetics.

richContent.overview: DEKA's most advanced Motus platform, offering both Moveo (pain-free in-motion) and traditional (high-speed pulsed) delivery modes. The new 24mm traditional spot size increases coverage by 78% for faster large-area treatments.
richContent.howItWorks: Two delivery modes: Moveo for premium comfort-focused treatments, and Traditional for high-speed, high-volume sessions. The 24mm spot in traditional mode dramatically reduces treatment times for large areas like backs and full legs. Both modes feature integrated cooling.
typicalUses: High-volume clinics needing speed (traditional mode) and comfort (Moveo mode)
Practices wanting to offer both premium pain-free and efficient express treatments
Full treatment menu with MoveoGlo skin rejuvenation protocol
richContent.keyFeatures: Best of both worlds: pain-free Moveo delivery for patient experience, plus 24mm traditional spot for speed when throughput matters. The most versatile Motus platform — DEKA markets it for skin rejuvenation (MoveoGlo protocol) alongside hair removal — but the underlying engineering priorities still favor hair removal. Successor to the Motus AZ+.

name: excel HR

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength system)

notes: Cutera's dual-wavelength Alexandrite + Nd:YAG. Also handles vascular lesions, pigmented lesions, and Cutera's Laser Genesis skin revitalization.

richContent.overview: Cutera's dual-wavelength hair removal system combining a high-power 755nm Alexandrite and their proven long-pulse 1064nm Nd:YAG with sapphire contact cooling.
richContent.howItWorks: The 755nm Alexandrite targets melanin efficiently for lighter skin types and finer hair, while the 1064nm Nd:YAG safely treats darker skin tones and tanned skin. Sapphire contact cooling provides constant skin protection throughout treatment.
typicalUses: All skin types with wavelength selection based on Fitzpatrick type
Clinics wanting dual-wavelength plus vascular and pigment treatment capabilities
richContent.keyFeatures: Sapphire cooling is always on (not pulsed like cryogen systems), providing continuous skin protection. Also supports Cutera's Laser Genesis skin revitalization, adding revenue streams beyond hair removal.

name: Neo Elite

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones, especially suited for darker skin (Nd:YAG with 650-microsecond technology)

notes: 1064nm Nd:YAG with unique 650-microsecond pulse technology. No cooling system, numbing, or contact gel needed. FDA-cleared for 36+ indications. Hair removal is one of many applications.

richContent.overview: Aerolase's multi-application 1064nm Nd:YAG laser using proprietary 650-microsecond pulse technology. Unique in that it requires no cooling system, no numbing cream, and no contact gel - the handpiece doesn't even touch the skin.
richContent.howItWorks: The 650-microsecond pulse duration is uniquely short, delivering high energy in brief bursts that heat the follicle while the surrounding skin's thermal relaxation time prevents damage. This eliminates the need for external cooling. The handpiece works at a distance from the skin (non-contact).
typicalUses: Practices specializing in darker skin types (Fitzpatrick IV-VI)
Multi-service clinics (36+ FDA-cleared indications including acne, rosacea, veins, rejuvenation)
Clinics wanting zero consumable costs (no cooling supplies, gels, or tips)
richContent.keyFeatures: Zero consumables and no-contact delivery mean lower operating costs. Particularly strong for diverse patient populations. Not primarily designed for hair removal - it's a versatile dermatology platform where hair removal is one of many capabilities.

name: MeDioStar

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones including tanned skin (dual diode wavelengths)

notes: German-engineered dual-wavelength diode laser (810nm + 940nm). Up to 5000W power. Distributed in the US by Astanza. Asclepion is a German company with 48+ years in the laser industry.

richContent.overview: Asclepion's flagship German-engineered diode laser, now in its 6th generation. Combines 810nm and 940nm wavelengths with up to 5000W power and the largest spot size (10 cm²) available in any diode system.
richContent.howItWorks: Blends 80% 810nm (optimal melanin absorption) with 20% 940nm (deeper penetration) for effective treatment across all skin types. TAPER fiber-bundle technology delivers a perfectly flat beam profile, eliminating hot spots. 360° Peltier contact cooling protects skin before each pulse. SmoothPulse mode enables high-frequency, low-pain treatments.
typicalUses: High-volume clinics (10 cm² Monolith XL treats full backs in ~5 minutes)
Year-round treatment including tanned skin
Practices wanting a modular system that grows with them
richContent.keyFeatures: Modular handpiece system (Monolith S, M, L, XL) lets clinics start small and expand. The 10 cm² XL spot is the largest on any diode system. German engineering with TAPER technology for perfectly uniform energy distribution. No hot spots means no striping or burns.

name: SP Dynamis

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (Nd:YAG wavelength)

notes: Fotona's flagship multi-application Nd:YAG platform. Hair removal is one of many applications including skin rejuvenation (4D facelift), vascular, and surgical. Also available with Er:YAG for ablative treatments. Slovenian-made with 60+ years of laser manufacturing.

richContent.overview: Fotona's premium Nd:YAG platform, widely used for hair reduction alongside a broad range of aesthetic and medical applications. Known for the FRAC3® three-dimensional treatment pattern and VSP (Variable Square Pulse) technology.
richContent.howItWorks: Uses 1064nm Nd:YAG with Fotona's proprietary FRAC3® delivery, which creates a three-dimensional fractional pattern that targets hair follicles at multiple depths. VSP technology provides precisely controlled square pulses for optimal energy delivery. The optional S-11 high-performance scanner enables rapid treatment of large areas.
typicalUses: All skin types, especially effective for darker skin (Nd:YAG safety)
Multi-application practices (hair removal, 4D facelift, vascular, surgical)
Clinics wanting a premium multi-purpose platform
richContent.keyFeatures: FRAC3® targets follicles at varying depths for thorough treatment. Fotona has 60+ years of laser manufacturing heritage. Not purpose-built for hair removal, but the Nd:YAG hair removal capability is well-proven. Often paired with Er:YAG in the dual-wavelength SP Dynamis configuration.

name: Thunder MT

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength with Mixed Technology)

notes: Italian-engineered dual-wavelength laser with patented Quanta Mixed Technology® for simultaneous or sequential wavelength delivery. Distributed in the US by Cartessa Aesthetics.

richContent.overview: Quanta System's dual-wavelength platform (755nm Alexandrite + 1064nm Nd:YAG) with their patented Mixed Technology® that allows simultaneous delivery of both wavelengths in a single pulse.
richContent.howItWorks: Two independent laser sources can fire individually or simultaneously via Mixed Technology®. Simultaneous mode combines Alexandrite's high melanin absorption with Nd:YAG's deep penetration in one pulse. The OptiScan TH scanner handpiece automatically delivers energy across wide areas with AutoMotion technology for even, low-pain treatment. Qool-air cooling system protects the skin.
typicalUses: All skin types year-round (Mixed Technology extends Alexandrite safety to darker tones)
High-speed treatment of large areas via OptiScan TH scanner
Practices wanting wavelength flexibility plus vascular and rejuvenation capabilities
richContent.keyFeatures: Mixed Technology® is unique: no other system fires both Alexandrite and Nd:YAG simultaneously. OptiScan TH scanner with super-elliptical spot shape eliminates hot spots from overlapping. Italian engineering from Quanta System (also makes surgical and urological lasers).

name: Venus Velocity

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (diode with adjustable parameters)

notes: 810nm diode laser with real-time cooling. Venus Concept is known for subscription-based equipment financing models that lower barrier to entry for clinics.

richContent.overview: Venus Concept's dedicated 810nm diode laser designed for hair removal across all skin types. Part of Venus Concept's ecosystem of aesthetic devices.
richContent.howItWorks: 810nm diode wavelength targets melanin in hair follicles. Real-time contact cooling protects the epidermis. Adjustable spot sizes and parameters for different body areas and skin types.
typicalUses: All body areas for Fitzpatrick I-VI
Clinics using Venus Concept's subscription financing model
richContent.keyFeatures: Venus Concept's subscription model allows clinics to access professional equipment without large upfront investment. This has made the Velocity popular with newer practices and those expanding into laser hair removal.

name: CoolGlide

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (Nd:YAG wavelength, especially suited for darker skin)

notes: 1064nm Nd:YAG. Originally developed by Altus Medical, acquired by Cutera. One of the earliest Nd:YAG lasers specifically marketed for hair removal on darker skin.

richContent.overview: Cutera's 1064nm Nd:YAG laser, one of the pioneering systems for safe hair removal on darker skin types. Originally developed by Altus Medical before Cutera acquisition.
richContent.howItWorks: The 1064nm Nd:YAG wavelength bypasses epidermal melanin to reach hair follicles safely on all skin types. Contact cooling protects the skin surface during treatment.
typicalUses: Darker skin types (Fitzpatrick V-VI) where other wavelengths are unsafe
Year-round treatment including tanned skin
Clinics serving diverse populations
richContent.keyFeatures: Long clinical track record for safe treatment of darker skin. The CoolGlide name became almost synonymous with Nd:YAG hair removal. Many units still in active service despite the newer excel HR being available.

name: Bare HR

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (tri-wavelength Blend Technology for darker skin safety)

notes: Sciton's dedicated hair removal platform launched in 2021. 4800W power. Two handpieces: standard 810nm and a Blend handpiece delivering 810+940+1060nm simultaneously. Won New Beauty 2022 Best of Beauty Innovation award.

richContent.overview: Sciton's first dedicated high-speed laser hair removal platform, launched in 2021. Built by the same company known for BBL and HALO, but unlike those IPL/hybrid devices, Bare HR is a true diode laser system with 4800 watts of power.
richContent.howItWorks: Two handpiece options: a standard 810nm diode for general use, and a proprietary Blend handpiece that simultaneously delivers 810nm, 940nm, and 1060nm wavelengths. The Blend mode targets hair at multiple depths while reducing impact on epidermal melanin, making it safe for darker and tanned skin year-round. Sapphire crystal contact cooling at 5°C protects skin throughout treatment. Two treatment modes: Speed and Comfort.
typicalUses: All skin types including darker and tanned skin (Blend mode)
High-volume clinics. Extra-large spot sizes (30x17mm) treat large areas in minutes
Practices already in the Sciton ecosystem (JOULE platform owners)
richContent.keyFeatures: 4800W is among the highest power outputs of any diode system. Extra-large spot sizes (30x17mm and 30x9mm) are the largest on the market. Claimed 3x faster than competitor devices. Important note: Sciton also makes Forever Bare BBL, which is IPL. Bare HR is their true laser alternative.

name: ClearScan YAG

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (Nd:YAG wavelength, especially suited for darker skin)

notes: 1064nm Nd:YAG with Large Area Pattern Generator (LAPG) for automated scanning. FDA-cleared for permanent hair reduction and PFB treatment. Also treats vascular lesions. Part of Sciton's JOULE/Profile platform.

richContent.overview: Sciton's 1064nm Nd:YAG laser module, available on the JOULE and Profile platforms. FDA-cleared for permanent hair reduction and pseudofolliculitis barbae (PFB). Also handles vascular lesions, making it a dual-purpose module rather than a dedicated hair removal device.
richContent.howItWorks: The Large Area Pattern Generator (LAPG) automatically scans a 30x30mm area with non-sequential spot placement, covering large areas 4x faster than manual hand-placed spots. A 250W thermoelectric contact chiller provides continuous cooling. The flat-top beam profile ensures uniform energy distribution with no hot spots.
typicalUses: Darker skin types (Fitzpatrick IV-VI) where Nd:YAG is safest
Tanned patients who cannot use Alexandrite or diode
Practices using Sciton JOULE/Profile platform wanting to add hair removal capability
richContent.keyFeatures: LAPG scanner covers a full back in ~200 scans versus thousands of manual spots on other systems. No consumable costs. Part of Sciton's modular platform. Clinics can add it alongside BBL, HALO, and other Sciton modules. Not a standalone device.

name: ClearScan ALX

skinTypes.displayText: Light to medium skin tones (Alexandrite wavelength)

notes: 755nm Alexandrite module for Sciton JOULE platform. Same LAPG scanning technology as the ClearScan YAG. Designed for lighter skin types with dark hair.

richContent.overview: Sciton's 755nm Alexandrite module for the JOULE platform. Shares the same LAPG scanning technology as the ClearScan YAG but at the Alexandrite wavelength for faster, more efficient treatment on lighter skin types.
richContent.howItWorks: 755nm Alexandrite has the highest melanin absorption of any hair removal wavelength, making it extremely effective for Fitzpatrick I-IV. The LAPG scanner automates coverage across large areas. Integrated thermoelectric contact cooling protects the skin.
typicalUses: Light to medium skin types with dark hair
Clinics on the Sciton JOULE platform wanting Alexandrite capability alongside other modules
richContent.keyFeatures: Same fast LAPG scanning as the ClearScan YAG. Part of Sciton's modular ecosystem. Not a standalone device. It's a module added to JOULE or Profile platforms.

name: Forever Bare BBL

skinTypes.displayText: Light to medium-dark skin tones

notes: Sciton's BBL (BroadBand Light) hair removal treatment. This is NOT a laser. It is a premium IPL system. Part of the JOULE platform. Often confused with Sciton's actual laser products (Bare HR, ClearScan).

richContent.overview: Sciton's IPL-based hair removal treatment using their BroadBand Light (BBL) technology. This is NOT a laser. It is a premium Intense Pulsed Light system. Sciton is a reputable manufacturer, but Forever Bare BBL uses broad-spectrum light, not a focused laser wavelength.
richContent.howItWorks: Uses Sciton's BBL flashlamp technology with interchangeable Smart Filters to deliver broad-spectrum light energy. The in-motion technique delivers multiple low-fluence pulses for gradual heating. While comfortable, it is fundamentally IPL technology and typically requires more sessions than true laser treatment for comparable results.
typicalUses: Clinics already using Sciton JOULE platform who want to add hair removal without purchasing a separate laser
Patients who prefer a gentler, lower-intensity approach
richContent.keyFeatures: Important distinction: Sciton makes BOTH this IPL device AND true lasers (Bare HR, ClearScan YAG/ALX). If your clinic uses Sciton equipment, ask specifically whether it's Forever Bare BBL (IPL) or Bare HR / ClearScan (real laser). The Sciton name alone does not guarantee laser treatment.

name: OMNI

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (multiple wavelengths and blend modes for darker skin safety)

notes: Sciton's newest hair removal platform, launched June 2025. Co-engineered with Asclepion (makers of the MeDioStar). 5000W power. Standalone device (not a JOULE module). Multiple wavelength handpieces: 760nm, 810/940nm blend, 940nm vascular, and 1060nm. Dual-port connectivity allows two handpieces connected simultaneously. Four spot sizes available. Standard 110V outlet.

richContent.overview: Sciton's newest and most advanced dedicated hair removal platform, launched in June 2025. Co-engineered in partnership with Asclepion (the German company behind the MeDioStar diode laser series). This is a standalone device, separate from Sciton's JOULE platform, and represents Sciton's most serious entry into dedicated laser hair removal.
richContent.howItWorks: Multiple wavelength handpieces cover the full range: 760nm for lighter skin types, an 810/940nm blend for general use and darker skin, standalone 940nm for vascular work, and 1060nm for the deepest penetration on dark and tanned skin. Up to 5000W of power (handpiece dependent) with four spot sizes including what Sciton claims is the industry's largest. Flat-top beam profile ensures uniform energy with no hot spots. Rectangular spot design reduces overlap. Dual-port connectivity keeps two handpieces connected simultaneously for seamless switching between treatment areas. Integrated sapphire contact cooling plus optional Spritz aloe-based spray as a gel-free alternative.
typicalUses: All skin types year-round including darker and tanned skin
High-volume clinics. Large spot sizes treat full backs in minutes
Practices wanting a premium standalone hair removal device outside the JOULE ecosystem
richContent.keyFeatures: Co-engineered with Asclepion brings German diode laser expertise to Sciton's platform. 5000W is among the highest power outputs available. Important context: Sciton also sells Forever Bare BBL (which is IPL, not laser). If a clinic says they use 'Sciton for hair removal', consumers should ask whether it's OMNI/Bare HR (real laser) or Forever Bare BBL (IPL). Optional single-use hygiene caps address the contact sanitation concern that some consumers have with shared handpieces.

name: eLase

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (diode laser + RF energy extends safety to darker skin)

notes: 810nm diode laser with elos technology (combined diode laser + bipolar radiofrequency). The Motif LHR handpiece is specifically designed for hair removal. Syneron merged with Candela in 2010; the company now operates as Candela Medical.

richContent.overview: Syneron's dedicated hair removal platform using their proprietary elos (Electro-Optical Synergy) technology. Combines an 810nm diode laser with bipolar radiofrequency energy. Syneron merged with Candela in 2010. The company now operates as Candela Medical, which also makes the GentleMax Pro series.
richContent.howItWorks: The elos approach uses the diode laser to pre-heat the hair follicle, then bipolar RF energy delivers additional heat directly to the follicle structure. Because the RF component doesn't depend on melanin absorption, it can disable follicles even when the laser alone wouldn't be sufficient, extending effectiveness to lighter hair colors and darker skin tones. The Motif LHR handpiece is the hair removal specific attachment.
typicalUses: Hair removal across all skin types including darker tones
Clinics that purchased Syneron equipment before the Candela merger
Practices treating patients with lighter or finer hair where pure laser alone is less effective
richContent.keyFeatures: The RF component is what distinguishes Syneron devices from pure diode lasers. It allows effective treatment with lower optical energy, reducing burn risk on darker skin. If your clinic uses an eLase, it IS a real laser (with RF enhancement). Syneron is now part of Candela Medical, the same company behind the GentleMax Pro series.

name: elos Plus

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (diode laser + RF for extended safety)

notes: Multi-application platform using elos technology (810nm diode laser + bipolar RF). Hair removal via DSL handpiece is one of several applications including wrinkle treatment, vascular lesions, and fractional skin rejuvenation. Successor to the eMax.

richContent.overview: Syneron's updated multi-application platform, successor to the eMax. Uses elos technology combining 810nm diode laser with bipolar radiofrequency. Hair removal is performed with the DSL (Diode Laser) handpiece, but the platform also handles wrinkles, vascular lesions, and skin rejuvenation with other handpieces.
richContent.howItWorks: Same elos principle as the eLase: diode laser pre-heats the target, then bipolar RF delivers additional energy independent of skin color. The DSL handpiece is the dedicated hair removal attachment operating at up to 3 Hz pulse rate. Multiple handpiece options (DSL, WRA, LV, LVA) plug in for different treatments.
typicalUses: Multi-service practices wanting hair removal plus skin rejuvenation from one platform
All skin types including darker tones via the RF component
Clinics upgrading from the older eMax system
richContent.keyFeatures: Versatile multi-application platform, not purpose-built for hair removal alone. The DSL handpiece provides real diode laser hair removal with RF enhancement. If your clinic uses an elos Plus for hair removal, confirm they are using the DSL handpiece (diode laser), not the IPL-based applicators that are also available on this platform.

name: eMax

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (varies by handpiece, laser or IPL depending on attachment)

notes: Syneron's original multi-application platform using elos technology. Hair removal via DSL/DS handpiece (810nm diode laser + RF). Also has IPL-based handpieces (SR, SRA) for other treatments. Important: the eMax platform includes BOTH laser and IPL handpieces. The technology used depends entirely on which handpiece is attached.

richContent.overview: Syneron's original multi-application elos platform, one of the most versatile aesthetic systems ever made. Handles hair removal, skin rejuvenation, vein treatment, acne, skin tightening, and wrinkle reduction through interchangeable handpieces. Important: the eMax has BOTH diode laser handpieces (DSL/DS for hair removal) and IPL-based handpieces (SR/SRA for skin rejuvenation).
richContent.howItWorks: The elos platform combines optical energy (either diode laser or IPL depending on the handpiece) with bipolar radiofrequency. For hair removal, the DSL handpiece uses an 810nm diode laser + RF with a 12x15mm spot size. For skin treatments, the SR/SRA handpieces use broadband light (IPL) + RF. The technology you receive depends entirely on which handpiece the clinic attaches.
typicalUses: Established clinics that invested in the eMax ecosystem years ago
Practices offering a wide menu of aesthetic services from one platform
Many eMax systems are still in active service despite being older technology
richContent.keyFeatures: Critical distinction: ask your clinic WHICH HANDPIECE they use for hair removal. The DSL/DS handpiece = real diode laser (good). The SR/SRA handpiece = IPL (not a laser). Same machine, very different technology depending on the attachment. The eMax is from a reputable manufacturer (Syneron, now Candela Medical) and many clinics still run them reliably, but the platform is older and has been superseded by the elos Plus.

name: Again

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength with Moveo technology)

notes: DEKA's high-power dual-wavelength Alexandrite + Nd:YAG laser with Moveo in-motion delivery. 30mm spot size, the largest in the industry for this laser type. Won the 2022 AMWC Award for Best Laser, Light and Energy-Based Device. Distributed in the US by Cartessa Aesthetics, in the UK by Lynton Lasers.

richContent.overview: DEKA's flagship high-power dual-wavelength laser designed for fast, pain-free hair removal and aesthetic treatments. Combines 755nm Alexandrite and 1064nm Nd:YAG with up to 13 standard handpiece spot sizes plus 4 Moveo handpieces (HR, PL, VL, SR). The 30mm spot size is the largest available in any Alexandrite/Nd:YAG system.
richContent.howItWorks: Two laser sources fire independently or in combination. Standard handpieces deliver traditional pulsed energy for high-speed treatments. Moveo handpieces use DEKA's sapphire-tip in-motion technology that glides continuously over the skin, delivering energy at lower fluence per pulse for virtually painless treatment. The Moveo sapphire tip works in full contact with the skin, reducing reflected energy from approximately 50% to nearly zero, effectively doubling the energy reaching the follicle.
typicalUses: All skin types year-round including darker tones via Moveo mode
High-volume clinics needing fast treatment (30mm spot covers large areas rapidly)
Practices wanting both hair removal and vascular/pigmented lesion/skin rejuvenation capabilities
richContent.keyFeatures: 30mm spot size is the industry's largest for Alexandrite/Nd:YAG lasers. Moveo technology provides virtually painless treatments without numbing cream. Both standard pulsed and Moveo in-motion delivery modes. Wi-Fi enabled with remote diagnostics. DEKA makes both the Again family (high-speed, large spot) and the Motus family (comfort-focused, compact), both using Moveo technology.

name: Again PRO

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength with Moveo technology)

notes: Upgraded version of the Again with increased power levels, faster repetition rates, and new specific pulses for treating fine and fair hair. Ranked second only to Lutronic Clarity II in independent comparative testing. Distributed in the US by Cartessa Aesthetics.

richContent.overview: The upgraded Again platform with increased power, faster treatment speeds, and new pulse profiles specifically designed for fine and fair hair. DEKA claims 50% faster treatment times compared to the original Again. Independent testing by Laserazor ranked it second only to the Lutronic Clarity II for overall hair removal efficacy.
richContent.howItWorks: Same dual-wavelength approach as the Again (755nm Alexandrite + 1064nm Nd:YAG) with both standard and Moveo handpieces. The PRO version adds higher power output, faster repetition rates, and optimized pulse shapes for vascular treatments. Up to 13 standard spot sizes and 4 Moveo handpieces (HR for hair removal, PL for pigmented lesions, VL for vascular lesions, SR for skin rejuvenation). MoveoGlo stacked treatment protocol combines SR + VL + PL handpieces for comprehensive skin rejuvenation.
typicalUses: All skin types including treatment of fine and fair hair (a traditionally difficult target)
High-volume clinics wanting maximum speed and versatility
Practices offering full aesthetic menus (hair removal, vascular, pigmentation, rejuvenation)
richContent.keyFeatures: Optimized pulse profiles for fine and fair hair set it apart from many competitors. Independent testing showed 91% hair reduction at 12 months. Plume protection mode activates during Moveo treatments for practitioner safety. Same Moveo technology as the Motus family but in a higher-power, larger-spot-size platform.

name: Again PRO PLUS

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength with Moveo technology)

notes: Latest and most powerful version of the Again family. Up to 25 kW peak power. Same 13 standard handpiece spot sizes and 4 Moveo handpieces as the Again PRO. Distributed in the US by Cartessa Aesthetics.

richContent.overview: DEKA's most powerful Again platform, the top of the line in their high-speed hair removal range. Up to 25 kW peak power with the same versatile handpiece ecosystem as the Again PRO. Represents DEKA's latest engineering in their dual-wavelength laser lineup.
richContent.howItWorks: Same dual-wavelength architecture and handpiece system as the Again PRO, with further increased power levels for even faster treatment speeds. Both standard pulsed delivery and Moveo in-motion modes. All 13 standard spot sizes and 4 Moveo handpieces (HR, PL, VL, SR) are compatible. MoveoGlo stacked treatment protocol available for comprehensive skin rejuvenation.
typicalUses: The busiest high-volume clinics needing absolute maximum speed
All skin types including fine and fair hair
Practices wanting the latest generation of DEKA's proven Again platform
richContent.keyFeatures: 25 kW peak power is among the highest of any aesthetic laser system. Successor to the Again PRO with increased power while maintaining the same handpiece compatibility and treatment protocols. DEKA now offers four distinct hair removal families: Again (high-speed), Motus (comfort-focused), and both share Moveo technology.

name: Duetto MT EVO

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength with Mixed Technology)

notes: Italian-engineered dual-wavelength laser with Quanta Mixed Technology for simultaneous or sequential wavelength delivery. Predecessor to the Thunder MT. Handles hair removal, vascular lesions, pigmented lesions, skin rejuvenation, and active acne. Distributed in the US by Cartessa Aesthetics. Optional TWAIN IPL and Er:YAG handpieces available.

richContent.overview: Quanta System's dual-wavelength platform using their patented Mixed Technology for simultaneous delivery of both 755nm Alexandrite and 1064nm Nd:YAG wavelengths. The Duetto MT EVO is the predecessor to the Thunder MT and remains widely used in clinics worldwide. Available with optional TWAIN IPL and Er:YAG handpieces for expanded treatment capabilities.
richContent.howItWorks: Two independent laser sources (Alexandrite 755nm and Nd:YAG 1064nm) can fire individually or simultaneously via second-generation Quanta Mixed Technology. Simultaneous mode lets practitioners adjust the proportion between the two wavelengths, combining Alexandrite's high melanin absorption with Nd:YAG's deep penetration in customizable ratios. Spot sizes up to 18mm. Integrated contact cooling with sapphire window at three temperature settings, plus optional external air cooling.
typicalUses: All skin types year-round (Mixed Technology extends Alexandrite safety to darker tones)
Multi-application clinics (hair removal, vascular, pigmentation, rejuvenation, acne)
Practices wanting the option to add IPL or Er:YAG capabilities via TWAIN modules
richContent.keyFeatures: Mixed Technology allows customizable wavelength blending, a feature unique to Quanta System devices. The TWAIN modular system lets clinics add IPL or Er:YAG handpieces at any time. Important: if your clinic uses a Duetto with the TWAIN IPL handpiece for hair removal, that specific treatment is IPL, not laser. Ask which handpiece is being used. The Duetto has been succeeded by the Thunder MT but many units remain in active clinical service.

name: Venus Epileve

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (diode with adjustable parameters)

notes: Venus Concept's compact tabletop 810nm diode laser. More affordable entry point than the Venus Velocity. FDA-cleared for hair removal, permanent hair reduction, and pseudofolliculitis barbae. Two treatment modes: PULSE and SLIDE. Part of Venus Concept's subscription-based equipment model.

richContent.overview: Venus Concept's compact, tabletop diode laser designed as an affordable entry point for clinics adding hair removal services. Uses the same 810nm diode wavelength as the larger Venus Velocity but in a portable form factor with IoT connectivity for business analytics.
richContent.howItWorks: 810nm diode laser with real-time contact cooling that monitors applicator temperature 1,000 times per second. Two treatment modes: PULSE for traditional spot-by-spot delivery and SLIDE for continuous gliding motion over larger areas. Ergonomic applicator designed for ambidextrous use, plus optional footswitch operation. No disposables required.
typicalUses: Newer or smaller clinics entering the hair removal market
Practices using Venus Concept's subscription financing to lower upfront costs
All body areas for Fitzpatrick I-VI
richContent.keyFeatures: Lower investment cost than the Venus Velocity makes it accessible for growing practices. IoT connectivity provides treatment data and business analytics. No disposable costs. Same subscription financing model as the Velocity. Compact tabletop design saves clinic floor space. It IS a real diode laser, not IPL, despite its lower price point compared to premium systems.

name: Venus Versa

skinTypes.displayText: Light to medium skin tones

notes: Venus Concept's multi-application IPL platform. This is NOT a laser. Uses Intense Pulsed Light with SmartPulse technology. Hair removal is one of many applications including photofacials, acne treatment, skin resurfacing, and wrinkle reduction. FDA-cleared for hair removal on Fitzpatrick I-IV only.

richContent.overview: Venus Concept's multi-application Intense Pulsed Light (IPL) platform. This is NOT a laser. It uses broad-spectrum light with SmartPulse technology for hair removal alongside photofacials, acne treatment, skin resurfacing, and wrinkle reduction. Venus Concept sells both this IPL device and true diode lasers (Velocity, Epileve).
richContent.howItWorks: Uses IPL (Intense Pulsed Light) with interchangeable applicators for different treatments. Hair removal applicators (HR650, HR690) use broad-spectrum light filtered to target melanin. SmartPulse technology aims to deliver consistent energy per pulse. Contact cooling protects the skin surface.
typicalUses: Multi-service clinics wanting diverse treatments from one platform
Practices prioritizing versatility over dedicated hair removal performance
Light to medium skin tones only (Fitzpatrick I-IV for hair removal)
richContent.keyFeatures: Important distinction: Venus Concept makes BOTH this IPL device AND true diode lasers (Venus Velocity, Venus Epileve). If your clinic uses Venus Concept equipment for hair removal, ask specifically whether it is the Versa (IPL) or Velocity/Epileve (real diode laser). The Venus name alone does not guarantee laser treatment. IPL hair removal typically requires more sessions than true laser for comparable results.

name: Clarity

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (dual wavelength system)

notes: Original dual-wavelength Alexandrite + Nd:YAG from Lutronic. Predecessor to the Clarity II. Still found in many clinics. Lutronic merged with Cynosure and now operates as Cynosure Lutronic.

richContent.overview: Lutronic's original dual-wavelength laser combining 755nm Alexandrite and 1064nm Nd:YAG. Predecessor to the widely acclaimed Clarity II. Many clinics still operate Clarity systems, which remain effective professional lasers. Lutronic has since merged with Cynosure and now operates as Cynosure Lutronic.
richContent.howItWorks: Dual-wavelength system with 755nm targeting melanin efficiently for lighter skin types and 1064nm penetrating deeper for safe treatment of darker skin. Single fiber delivery for all spot sizes. Dual cooling system combines cryogen spray for instant skin protection with air cooling for sustained comfort.
typicalUses: All skin types with dual-wavelength flexibility
Clinics that invested in Lutronic before the Clarity II launch
Practices still running proven equipment alongside newer devices
richContent.keyFeatures: The original Clarity established Lutronic's reputation in the hair removal market. It IS a real dual-wavelength laser and remains a capable professional device. The Clarity II added IntelliTrak guidance, temperature sensing, and faster repetition rates. If your clinic uses a Clarity (not Clarity II), you are still receiving genuine dual-wavelength laser treatment from a reputable manufacturer.

name: Light EVO Series

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (wavelength dependent)

notes: Quanta System's modular multi-wavelength platform. Available in up to 10 configurations combining Alexandrite 755nm, Nd:YAG 1064nm, Nd:YAG FD 532nm, and optional 1320nm. Hair removal is one of many applications. Can add optional TWAIN IPL and Er:YAG handpieces. Distributed in the US by Cartessa Aesthetics.

richContent.overview: Quanta System's modular multi-wavelength platform available in up to 10 different configurations. Can combine Alexandrite 755nm, Nd:YAG 1064nm, frequency-doubled Nd:YAG 532nm, and optional 1320nm for skin rejuvenation. Hair removal is one of many applications including vascular lesions, pigmented lesions, and skin tightening.
richContent.howItWorks: Unlike the Thunder MT and Duetto MT, the Light EVO does not include Quanta Mixed Technology (no simultaneous wavelength firing). Each wavelength fires independently. Integrated contact cooling with sapphire window at three temperature settings. Optional TWAIN IPL and Er:YAG handpieces can be added for expanded treatment capabilities. Features Quanta's Power+ technology for high energy output.
typicalUses: Multi-application clinics wanting a configurable platform
Practices that need hair removal plus vascular and pigmented lesion treatment
Clinics that may later want to add IPL or Er:YAG via TWAIN modules
richContent.keyFeatures: Highly configurable with up to 10 model variants. Does NOT include Mixed Technology (that is exclusive to the Thunder MT and Duetto MT). Italian-engineered by Quanta System. If your clinic uses a Light EVO for hair removal, it IS a real laser, but ask which wavelength they are using and confirm it is the laser handpiece, not the optional TWAIN IPL attachment.

name: XP Dynamis

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (Nd:YAG wavelength)

notes: Fotona's Nd:YAG-only platform. Simplified version of the SP Dynamis without the Er:YAG component. Hair removal is one of many applications including skin tightening, vascular lesions, and laser lipolysis. Same VSP and FRAC3 technology as the SP Dynamis.

richContent.overview: Fotona's Nd:YAG-only platform, a streamlined version of the SP Dynamis without the Er:YAG laser component. Uses the same VSP (Variable Square Pulse) technology and FRAC3 three-dimensional treatment pattern for hair removal. Covers a wide range of non-ablative aesthetic and medical applications.
richContent.howItWorks: 1064nm Nd:YAG with Fotona's proprietary FRAC3 delivery, creating a three-dimensional fractional pattern that targets hair follicles at multiple depths. VSP technology provides precisely controlled square pulses. The optional S-11 high-performance scanner enables rapid treatment of large areas. Without the Er:YAG component, it cannot perform ablative resurfacing treatments.
typicalUses: All skin types, especially effective for darker skin (Nd:YAG safety)
Multi-application practices not needing ablative resurfacing
Clinics wanting Fotona's proven Nd:YAG technology at a lower price point than the SP Dynamis
richContent.keyFeatures: Same core Nd:YAG technology as the SP Dynamis but without Er:YAG capability. Fotona has 60+ years of laser manufacturing heritage. Not purpose-built for hair removal. If your clinic uses a Fotona XP Dynamis, you are receiving genuine Nd:YAG laser treatment from a well-established manufacturer.

name: Dynamis Max

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones (Nd:YAG wavelength)

notes: Fotona's latest flagship multi-application Nd:YAG + Er:YAG platform. Successor to the SP Dynamis with enhanced capabilities. Hair removal is one of many applications including the Fotona4D facelift, skin resurfacing, vascular treatments, and surgical applications.

richContent.overview: Fotona's most advanced multi-application platform, the successor to the SP Dynamis. Combines Nd:YAG and Er:YAG laser sources for the widest range of aesthetic and medical applications. Hair removal uses the 1064nm Nd:YAG component with FRAC3 and VSP technologies.
richContent.howItWorks: Dual-laser system with 1064nm Nd:YAG for non-ablative treatments (hair removal, vascular, skin tightening) and Er:YAG for ablative treatments (resurfacing, surgical). For hair removal specifically, it uses the same FRAC3 three-dimensional treatment pattern and VSP pulse control as the SP Dynamis. Compatible with the S-11 scanner for large-area coverage.
typicalUses: Premium multi-application practices with diverse treatment menus
All skin types for hair removal via Nd:YAG
Clinics performing both aesthetic and surgical laser procedures
richContent.keyFeatures: Fotona's top-of-the-line platform. Not purpose-built for hair removal, but the Nd:YAG hair removal capability is proven and effective. Clinics investing in a Dynamis Max are typically focused on a broad treatment portfolio rather than dedicated hair removal. If hair removal is your primary concern, ask whether the clinic also offers a dedicated hair removal system.

name: DermRays V4S

skinTypes.displayText: Designed for lighter skin tones (Fitzpatrick I-IV).

notes: Entry-level home diode laser. 810nm, lower energy output than V8S. FDA cleared (510(k) K230090 covers V4S and V8S).

richContent.overview: DermRays' entry-level home diode laser. Uses the same 810nm wavelength as clinical diode lasers but at consumer-grade power levels.
richContent.howItWorks: 810nm diode laser targets melanin in hair follicles. Lower fluence than clinical devices means more sessions required for results.
typicalUses: Home hair removal maintenance
Small treatment areas
richContent.keyFeatures: FDA cleared. More affordable entry point than the V8S. Same wavelength as clinical diode lasers but significantly lower power.

name: DermRays V8S

skinTypes.displayText: Designed for lighter skin tones (Fitzpatrick I-IV).

notes: Most powerful home 810nm laser by total energy per pulse (27J/pulse, 9 J/cm2, 3 cm2 window). FDA cleared K230090 (April 2023). SGS-tested claim of 82% average reduction. Clinical devices deliver 25-40 J/cm2. Pulse duration undisclosed.

richContent.overview: The most powerful consumer 810nm diode laser by total energy output. Delivers 27 joules per pulse across a 3 cm2 spot, yielding 9 J/cm2 fluence.
richContent.howItWorks: 810nm diode laser targets melanin in hair follicles. At 9 J/cm2, it delivers roughly one-third the fluence of clinical diode lasers (25-40 J/cm2 typical). Pulse duration is not disclosed by the manufacturer.
typicalUses: Home hair removal for body and facial areas
Maintenance between professional sessions
Small to medium treatment areas
richContent.keyFeatures: Highest energy output among widely available home lasers. FDA cleared. SGS third-party testing claims 82% reduction. Independent reviews reported limited results, likely due to the fluence gap versus clinical devices.

name: DermRays V6S

skinTypes.displayText: Marketed for all skin tones including darker skin (Fitzpatrick I-VI).

notes: Home diode laser marketed for darker skin tones. FDA cleared under GEX product code. Uses 810nm wavelength. Clinical devices for dark skin typically use 1064nm Nd:YAG.

richContent.overview: DermRays' home laser designed for darker skin tones. Uses 810nm diode wavelength rather than the 1064nm Nd:YAG typically used clinically for dark skin.
richContent.howItWorks: 810nm diode targets melanin. For darker skin, clinical providers typically prefer 1064nm Nd:YAG because it bypasses epidermal melanin more effectively.
typicalUses: Home hair removal for darker skin tones
Small treatment areas
richContent.keyFeatures: One of few home lasers marketed for Fitzpatrick V-VI. FDA cleared under GEX product code. No independent clinical studies on efficacy for dark skin.

name: CurrentBody Skin Laser

skinTypes.displayText: Designed for lighter skin tones (Fitzpatrick I-IV).

notes: Home 810nm diode laser. 7 J/cm2, 3 cm2 window, mains-powered. Launched November 2023. Claims FDA clearance but specific 510(k) number not publicly identified. ~$399.

richContent.overview: CurrentBody's home-use 810nm diode laser for hair removal. Mains-powered design eliminates battery limitations.
richContent.howItWorks: 810nm diode laser at 7 J/cm2 fluence. Mains-powered for consistent energy delivery. 3 cm2 treatment window.
typicalUses: Home hair removal
Small treatment areas
Maintenance between professional sessions
richContent.keyFeatures: Mains-powered (no battery degradation). 7 J/cm2 fluence. Claims FDA clearance but specific 510(k) not publicly verified.

name: Epilaser Pro

skinTypes.displayText: 808nm model for lighter skin tones (Fitzpatrick I-IV).

notes: Camera-guided home laser with SPOT targeting. Claims 24 J/cm2 at individual follicles. Three FDA clearances: K170970 (2017), K213105 (2022), K233224 (2024). Claims 70% reduction in 3 months. No independent clinical verification. ~$999.

richContent.overview: Camera-guided home laser that targets individual hair follicles rather than treating a broad area. Third generation product with three FDA clearances.
richContent.howItWorks: The SPOT camera system identifies individual follicles and delivers laser energy precisely to each one. Claims 24 J/cm2 per follicle. Per-follicle approach means very small effective spot sizes.
typicalUses: Home hair removal with precision targeting
Individual follicle treatment
richContent.keyFeatures: Camera-guided follicle detection. Claims clinical-level fluence per follicle. Three FDA clearances. All efficacy data is manufacturer-only with no independent clinical studies as of early 2026.

name: Epilaser 980nm

skinTypes.displayText: 980nm variant designed for darker skin tones.

notes: Dark-skin variant using 980nm wavelength. Clinical devices for dark skin use 1064nm Nd:YAG. Same camera-guided SPOT targeting. No independent clinical studies.

richContent.overview: Epilaser's dark-skin variant using a 980nm wavelength, a non-standard choice for hair removal.
richContent.howItWorks: 980nm wavelength sits between the standard diode (808-810nm) and Nd:YAG (1064nm). Less epidermal melanin absorption than 808nm, but clinical evidence for 980nm in hair removal is limited.
typicalUses: Home hair removal for darker skin tones
richContent.keyFeatures: Uses non-standard 980nm wavelength (clinical standard for dark skin is 1064nm Nd:YAG). Camera-guided targeting. No independent studies.

name: LUMINA

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones with appropriate handpiece selection. Nd:YAG upgrade for darker skin.

notes: UK-manufactured IPL + laser platform by Lynton Lasers. Modular system. NHS Supply Chain listed. 650nm and 585nm IPL handpieces standard, with optional 1064nm Nd:YAG and Q-switched upgrades. Major UK market presence.

richContent.overview: Lynton's flagship modular IPL and laser platform, British-manufactured and NHS Supply Chain listed. Dominant in the UK aesthetic market.
richContent.howItWorks: Dual IPL handpieces (585nm and 650nm) for hair removal and skin treatments. Optional 1064nm Nd:YAG for darker skin and deeper lesions. ILG (Interchangeable Light Guide) technology for spot size customization.
typicalUses: Hair removal (IPL and Nd:YAG)
Skin rejuvenation
Vascular and pigmented lesion treatment
Tattoo removal (Q-switched upgrade)
richContent.keyFeatures: Modular platform. NHS listed. Over 20 years UK manufacturing. Built-in patient database.

name: Spectrum

skinTypes.displayText: All skin types with appropriate handpiece selection.

notes: Multi-platform 5-in-1 system: 810nm diode (hair removal), IPL, 1064nm Nd:YAG (vascular), Q-switched 1064/532nm (tattoo), 2940nm erbium (resurfacing). Portable, no consumables. US-made.

richContent.overview: Rohrer Aesthetics' all-in-one laser and IPL platform. Five handpieces in one portable system.
richContent.howItWorks: 810nm diode for hair removal with contact cooling and up to 10 pulses/second. Each handpiece has self-contained cooling.
typicalUses: Laser hair removal (810nm diode)
Tattoo removal (Q-switched)
Vascular treatment
Skin resurfacing (erbium)
IPL photofacial
richContent.keyFeatures: No consumables. Portable. Entry-level multi-modality platform. Popular with startup practices.

name: Primelase Excellence

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones with multi-wavelength selection.

notes: Ultra-high power diode platform (4,800W). Four wavelengths: Alex 755nm, Diode 810nm, Blend (810+940+1060nm), Yag 1060nm. Patented USP (Ultra Short Pulse) technology from 3ms. Crystal Freeze cooling at 5C. Spanish-made. Growing European presence.

richContent.overview: Cocoon Medical's flagship multi-wavelength diode laser platform. 4,800W across four wavelengths. Spanish-engineered, distributed globally through Sinclair.
richContent.howItWorks: Four wavelength options for different skin types and hair depths. USP technology delivers pulses as short as 3ms. Crystal Freeze cooling at 5C throughout treatment.
typicalUses: Hair removal on all phototypes
Vascular lesions
Pigmented lesions
Acne treatment
Skin rejuvenation
richContent.keyFeatures: 4,800W power. Four wavelengths. USP ultra-short pulses. Spot sizes up to 30x17mm. Growing rapidly in European markets.

name: Fusion (Light & Dark)

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones. Fusion Light for I-IV, Fusion Dark for IV-VI.

notes: InMode's dedicated hair removal handpieces for Triton and OptimasMAX platforms. Three wavelengths: 755nm Alexandrite, 810nm Diode, 1064nm Nd:YAG. FusionXL is the large-spot variant.

richContent.overview: InMode's multi-wavelength hair removal system. Combines three wavelengths for all skin types.
richContent.howItWorks: Mosaic combination of 755nm, 810nm, and 1064nm targets hair at different depths simultaneously. Light variant for lighter skin, Dark for darker skin.
typicalUses: Hair removal on all skin types
Large area body treatments (FusionXL)
Dark skin hair removal
richContent.keyFeatures: Three wavelengths in one handpiece. Dedicated Light and Dark configurations. FusionXL for large areas. Part of InMode modular ecosystem.

name: BBL HERO

skinTypes.displayText: Most skin tones with appropriate filter selection.

notes: Sciton's high-powered BroadBand Light platform. HERO = High Energy Rapid Output. One of the most powerful clinical IPL systems. Demonstrates that clinical IPL can deliver real results for hair removal.

richContent.overview: Sciton's flagship BroadBand Light system. One of the clinical IPL systems that demonstrates IPL can deliver results in professional settings.
richContent.howItWorks: BroadBand Light with multiple cutoff filters for wavelength customization. HERO technology provides higher energy and faster repetition rates.
typicalUses: Hair removal
Photorejuvenation
Pigmented lesions
Vascular lesions
Acne
richContent.keyFeatures: One of the most powerful clinical IPL platforms. Multiple filters. Thermoelectric cooling. Demonstrates clinical IPL can be effective for hair removal.

name: M22

skinTypes.displayText: All skin tones with appropriate module selection.

notes: Lumenis' multi-application IPL and laser platform. OPT (Optimal Pulse Technology) for consistent energy delivery. One of the most widely used clinical IPL systems globally.

richContent.overview: Lumenis' flagship multi-application platform combining advanced IPL with optional laser modules. One of the most widely deployed clinical IPL systems worldwide.
richContent.howItWorks: OPT ensures consistent energy across the entire pulse, unlike conventional IPL where energy peaks at the start. ExpertFilters for precise wavelength selection.
typicalUses: Hair removal (IPL)
Skin rejuvenation
Vascular and pigmented lesions
Acne
Skin resurfacing (ResurFX module)
richContent.keyFeatures: OPT technology. Modular design. ExpertFilters. One of the most clinically studied IPL platforms.

name: SHR (Super Hair Removal)
whatItIs: SHR stands for Super Hair Removal. It is a delivery method, not a type of light source.
whyItMatters: SHR describes HOW energy is delivered (gradual heating with rapid pulses), not WHAT delivers it. SHR can be applied to real diode lasers (like Soprano) or to IPL machines. The term SHR alone does not tell you if you are getting a real laser treatment. You must ask what device powers the SHR - a $100,000 Soprano laser and a $3,000 generic IPL can both claim to offer SHR treatments.
askYourClinic: What is the brand and model of the device delivering SHR? Is it a Soprano laser or an IPL machine?

name: Moveo (DEKA In-Motion Technology)
whatItIs: Moveo is DEKA's proprietary in-motion delivery method for their Motus laser family. The sapphire-tipped handpiece glides continuously over the skin, delivering energy at lower fluence per pulse with gradual heating.
whyItMatters: Moveo is a delivery method exclusive to DEKA/Cartessa Motus laser systems (Motus AX, Motus AZ+, Motus PRO). Unlike SHR which can be used on any device, Moveo is hardware-specific - if a clinic says they use Moveo, they should have a genuine DEKA Motus device. The sapphire tip's flush contact reduces energy reflection from ~50% to nearly zero, meaning more energy reaches the follicle at lower power settings.
askYourClinic: What specific Motus model do you use? (Motus AX, AZ+, or PRO)

name: AFT (Advanced Fluorescence Technology)
whatItIs: AFT is Alma branded IPL technology that uses fluorescence to convert UV light to usable wavelengths.
whyItMatters: AFT is NOT a laser - it is a form of IPL. While Alma AFT technology is considered higher quality than generic IPL, it is still fundamentally an Intense Pulsed Light system, not a true laser. Results typically require more sessions than laser treatment.

name: BBL (BroadBand Light)
whatItIs: BBL is Sciton branded Intense Pulsed Light system, considered a premium IPL device.
